But considering there are thousands of companies that we would ideally be updating monthly, as well as future goals of also providing quick and digestible summaries and insights for newly released earnings and conference calls, breaking news, FED speeches, etc, this quickly becomes very costly.

For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. Thanks! - QuickTick AI

# Warby Parker Inc. (NYSE: WRBY) Sell-Side Analysis Report

**Current Stock Metrics (as of October 10, 2024, close - sourced from Yahoo Finance and Nasdaq):**
- Stock Price: $14.62
- Market Capitalization: $1.45 billion
- 52-Week Range: $10.05 - $17.78
- Trailing P/E: N/A (unprofitable)
- Forward P/E: 68.49

## Company Overview (248 words)
Warby Parker Inc. (WRBY) is a vertically integrated eyewear company founded in 2010 and headquartered in New York City. It revolutionized the $140+ billion U.S. eyewear market by offering affordable, stylish prescription glasses, sunglasses, and contact lenses through a direct-to-consumer (DTC) model, bypassing traditional high-markup optical retail. The company designs its own frames in-house, manufactures via third-party labs, and sells primarily online with a growing network of over 250 physical retail stores across the U.S. and Canada as of Q2 2024. Warby Parker expanded into brick-and-mortar in 2013 with showrooms and now emphasizes an omnichannel approach, with ~20% of revenue from retail stores.

Key differentiators include a home try-on program (5 frames free for 5 days), virtual try-on tech, a buy-one-give-one social mission (over 10 million pairs donated), and insurance reimbursement partnerships. In 2023, it acquired its first optical lab in Sloatsburg, NY (opened 2024), reducing lead times and costs. WRBY reported Q2 2024 revenue of $198.2 million (up 13.8% YoY) on August 13, 2024, with adjusted EBITDA of $29.5 million (up 53% YoY), narrowing net loss to $11.5 million. The company serves ~5 million customers annually, focusing on millennials/Gen Z with trendy, accessible pricing ($95+ for glasses). Amid sector consolidation under EssilorLuxottica's dominance, Warby Parker targets market share gains via store expansion (target 50 net new stores in 2024), brand strength, and tech innovation, positioning as a disruptor in a fragmented market.

## Recent Developments
- **Q2 2024 Earnings (August 13, 2024)**: Revenue $198.2M (+13.8% YoY); direct segment +11.1%, retail +18.2%; 775k units sold (+10.7%); raised FY2024 revenue guidance to $757-762M (+12-13% YoY).
- **Store Expansion**: Opened 40 net new stores YTD Q2 2024; Sloatsburg optical lab fully operational (July 2024), processing 20%+ of volume, improving margins.
- **Product Launches**: Introduced "Scuderia Ferrari" collaboration sunglasses (September 2024); expanded contact lens offerings with daily disposables.
- **Executive Changes**: Dave Gilboa (co-CEO) stepped down September 2024; Neil Blumenthal now sole CEO.
- **Q3 2024 Guidance (August 13)**: Revenue $189-192M (+9-12% YoY).

## Growth Strategy
- **Omnichannel Expansion**: 40-50 net new stores in 2024 (total ~290 by YE); target 1,000 stores long-term.
- **Vertical Integration**: Scale owned optical labs (2nd lab in NYC Q4 2024); in-house frame production pilots.
- **Customer Acquisition**: Marketing via social media, podcasts; loyalty program enhancements; insurance partnerships (e.g., EyeMed, VSP).
- **International**: Canada focus; exploring Europe/Asia pilots.
- **Diversification**: Grow contacts (10%+ of revenue, +30% YoY Q2), sunglasses (+20% YoY).

## Headwinds and Tailwinds
| Category | Tailwinds | Headwinds |
|----------|-----------|-----------|
| **Company-Specific** | Strong brand loyalty (NPS 80+); margin expansion (gross margin 53.1% Q2, +140bps YoY); lab efficiencies. | Ongoing losses ($11.5M Q2 net loss); high SG&A (47.7% of revenue); CEO transition risks. |
| **Sector-Wide** | DTC eyewear growth (CAGR 10%+); aging population driving vision correction; e-commerce penetration <20%. | EssilorLuxottica monopoly (~80% U.S. market via Luxottica/OPSMs); regulatory scrutiny (FTC probe July 2023 ongoing); economic slowdown hitting discretionary spend. |

## Existing Products/Services
- Prescription eyeglasses ($95-$200; 80% revenue).
- Sunglasses ($95-$150).
- Contact lenses (ACUVUE, Biotrue; insurance-covered).
- Accessories (cases, cleaners).
- Eye exams in stores (~2M annually).

## New Products/Services/Projects
- **Optical Labs**: 2nd lab NYC (Q4 2024); target 50% volume by 2026.
- **Ferrari Collaboration**: Limited-edition sunglasses (launched Sept 2024).
- **AI Virtual Try-On**: Enhanced app (beta Q3 2024).
- **Contacts Expansion**: New daily lenses partnerships (announced Q2 2024).

## Market Share and Forecast
- **U.S. Eyewear Market (~$40B)**: WRBY ~1.5-2% (2023 est., per company filings and Statista); DTC segment ~5-7% share.
- **Forecast**: +20-30bps annual gain to 2.5-3% by 2026 via store growth/labs (management target); DTC peers gaining as Luxottica flatlines.

## Competitor Comparison
| Metric (2023/TTM) | WRBY | EssilorLuxottica (ESLOY) | Zenni Optical (Private) | 1-800 Contacts (owned by KKR) |
|-------------------|------|---------------------------|--------------------------|-------------------------------|
| Revenue | $679M | $26B | ~$300M (est.) | ~$600M (est.) |
| Growth YoY | +12% | +7% | +15-20% | +10% |
| Gross Margin | 52% | 65% | 60%+ | 55% |
| Stores/Channels | 250 DTC/retail | 18k global | Online-only | Online/physical |
| Edge | Brand/affordability | Scale/distribution | Ultra-low price | Contacts focus |

WRBY outperforms on growth but lags margins/scale vs. EL.

## Partnerships, M&A, Clients
- **Partnerships**: EyeMed/VSP insurance (key for contacts/exams); Scuderia Ferrari (Sept 2024 collab); Google Cloud for AI try-on.
- **M&A**: None recent; acquired Hudson Optical lab (2023, operational 2024).
- **Clients**: DTC consumers (5M+ customers); enterprise pilots with employers for vision benefits.

## Other Qualitative Measures
- **ESG**: Buy-a-pair-give-a-pair (14M+ donated); sustainable acetate frames.
- **Innovation**: Patents in 3D printing frames; app downloads 10M+.
- **Risks**: Macro sensitivity (luxury-adjacent); competition from Warby clones (e.g., Eyebuydirect).
- **Sentiment**: Positive analyst buzz post-Q2 (9 Buys/4 Holds, per Yahoo; avg PT $18.50); Reddit/Twitter talking points focus on lab margins, store traffic (+13% Q2).

## Investment Recommendation
- **Buy Rating**: 7/10 (Hold-to-Buy). Strong growth (12%+ rev), margin leverage, and DTC moat support upside, but profitability path (EBITDA positive 2024) and sector risks warrant caution. Suitable for moderate-risk growth portfolios.
- **Estimated Fair Value**: $20.00 (37% upside). Based on 1.2x FY2025 sales ($850M est., 12% growth), 25x EV/EBITDA (peer avg), incorporating lab efficiencies and 15% CAGR to 2027. DCF assumes 12% rev growth, 55% margins, 10% WACC.
